div1.p: Simpson thanks Hench for a reprint of his story on yellow fever.

div1.head: Letter from Walter M. Simpson to Philip Showalter Hench, December 4, 1941
div1.opener:
KETTERING INSTITUTE FOR MEDICAL RESEARCH
THE MIAMI VALLEY HOSPITAL
DAYTON, OHIO
December 4, 1941
WALTER M. SIMPSON, M. D., F.A.C.P., DIRECTOR
H. WORLEY KENDELL, M. D., ASSOCIATE DIRECTOR
DONALD L. ROSE, M. D., RESEARCH ASSOCIATE
Doctor Philip S. Hench,
Mayo Clinic,
Rochester, Minnesota.
My dear Phil:
div1.p:
It was like you to remember to send me a reprint
of your swell story on yellow fever. Morris Fishbein
certainly set it up in grand style.

I am happy to report that June is much better.
She is up and around about half the time now and I
suspect that she will be hitting her normal stride
in the next few weeks. She joins me in sending
affectionate greetings from House to House.
div1.closer: Always yours, Walter M. Simpson, M. D. WMS/B
